page.title: 16Land use around Strathmiglo
page.content: Most of the land around Strathmiglo is rich farmland either under crops or grass for cutting as silage.Some of the land is grassland used for pasture.The main cash crops are wheat and barley,both winter and spring, followed by potatoes and oil seed rape. This is just the second year that oil seed rape has been grown in this part of the country.Farmers are offered a special financial incentive by the Common Market for growing this crop.Silage is used for the feeding of animals, in particular the beef cattle,continental cross breeds,which local farmers keep. Much of the winter barley grown is also used for feeding animals. All the local farmers keep beef cattle though one farmer concentrates on his herd of Fresian cows and another on mainly Blackface sheep.
